chargeHist.descr: Poessess Firearm - Dom Abuse, Child Abuse, Ind at Risk Injunction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey A. Petrie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeffrey A. Petrie is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeffrey A. Petrie was found guilty of Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Forfeiture of 30.06 Remington rifle with accessories and ammunition.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Poessess Firearm - Dom Abuse, Child Abuse, Ind at Risk Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey A. Petrie

records.addlTxt: Application mailed to the Office of the Governor and a copy to the defendant

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeffrey A. Petrie appeared with attorney David Deda.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint acknowledged, reading waived. DA files information. Parties received and reviewed and waive reading. DA states agreement. Court questions defendant regarding preliminary hearing waiver form. Court finds waiver to be free and knowing and accepts. Defendant pleads NO CONTEST to Ct. 1.   Court questions DE regarding the plea and plea questionnaire.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Ct. 1 and on motion of DA dismisses Ct. 2. Comments by parties. Comments and ruling by Court. Court informs defendant regarding firearm restrictions of a convicted felon. Appeal rights given. Adj. 10:33 am. 

Court imposes (Ct. 1): $400 fine; $250 DNAAS and submit sample; 30.06 Remington rifle with accessories and ammunition is forfeited. Payplan of $100/mo beginning last business day of February, 2016 and each month thereafter until paid in full or CO.
Request to move the return date - granted
State's Demand for Discovery & Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release. Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney. Defendant may not possess firearms.

9:30 am - Plaintiff, District Attorney Mark T. Fuhr, in person. Defendant, in person, in custody. Case called, appearances and possible charges stated. Defendant's next court date is 12-22-15 at 10:00 am. Court gives defendant notice of right to attorney and victim/witness intimidation form. Court questions parties as to bond. DA states bond recommendation. Court grants DA 5 business days in which to file complaint.
